data.title: 2×2×2 Rubik’s cube movements
data.solution:
# Read inputs from Standard Input.
# Write outputs to Standard Output.

import sys

m=raw_input()
i=0
while i<len(m):
    if m[i]=="'":
        m=m[:i]+m[i-1]*2+m[i+1:]
    elif m[i]=="2":
        m=m[:i]+m[i-1]+m[i+1:]
    elif m[i] not in "RLUDFB":
        m=m[:i]+m[i+1:]
    i+=1

coul={"F":["F"]*4,"B":["B"]*4,"R":["R"]*4,"L":["L"]*4,"U":["U"]*4,"D":["D"]*4}

#      U0U1
#      U3U2
# 
# L0L1 F0F1 R0R1 B0B1
# L3L2 F3F2 R3R2 B3B2
# 
#      D0D1
#      D3D2

for c in m:
    coul[c]=[coul[c][3]]+coul[c][:3]
    if c=="R":
        coul["F"][1],coul["U"][1],coul["B"][3],coul["D"][1]=coul["D"][1],coul["F"][1],coul["U"][1],coul["B"][3]
        coul["F"][2],coul["U"][2],coul["B"][0],coul["D"][2]=coul["D"][2],coul["F"][2],coul["U"][2],coul["B"][0]
    elif c=="F":
        coul["L"][1],coul["U"][2],coul["R"][3],coul["D"][0]=coul["D"][0],coul["L"][1],coul["U"][2],coul["R"][3]
        coul["L"][2],coul["U"][3],coul["R"][0],coul["D"][1]=coul["D"][1],coul["L"][2],coul["U"][3],coul["R"][0]
    elif c=="U":
        coul["L"][1],coul["B"][1],coul["R"][1],coul["F"][1]=coul["F"][1],coul["L"][1],coul["B"][1],coul["R"][1]
        coul["L"][0],coul["B"][0],coul["R"][0],coul["F"][0]=coul["F"][0],coul["L"][0],coul["B"][0],coul["R"][0]
    elif c=="L":
        coul["F"][0],coul["D"][0],coul["B"][2],coul["U"][0]=coul["U"][0],coul["F"][0],coul["D"][0],coul["B"][2]
        coul["F"][3],coul["D"][3],coul["B"][1],coul["U"][3]=coul["U"][3],coul["F"][3],coul["D"][3],coul["B"][1]
    elif c=="B":
        coul["L"][0],coul["D"][3],coul["R"][2],coul["U"][1]=coul["U"][1],coul["L"][0],coul["D"][3],coul["R"][2]
        coul["L"][3],coul["D"][2],coul["R"][1],coul["U"][0]=coul["U"][0],coul["L"][3],coul["D"][2],coul["R"][1]
    elif c=="D":
        coul["L"][3],coul["F"][3],coul["R"][3],coul["B"][3]=coul["B"][3],coul["L"][3],coul["F"][3],coul["R"][3]
        coul["L"][2],coul["F"][2],coul["R"][2],coul["B"][2]=coul["B"][2],coul["L"][2],coul["F"][2],coul["R"][2]
        
print(coul["F"][0]+coul["F"][1])
print(coul["F"][3]+coul["F"][2])
data.statement:
You have to print the colours of the [[Front]] side of a 2×2×2 Rubik’s cube after some moves.
The colours are named by the first letter of each side ([[Front]], [[Back]], [[Right]], [[Left]], [[Up]], [[Down]]).
The moves are named the same way if you turn the side [[clockwise]].
For example [[F]] moves the [[Front]] side clockwise, [[F']] turns it anticlockwise and [[F2]] turns it twice. [[B]] turns it clockwise when you look at the [[Back]] side.
You won’t be given moves such as [[F5]], [[B52]] or [[U'3]].
data.inputDescription: The moves in one single line, for example [[B']] possibly with dots (for human readability, you can ignore them).
data.outputDescription:
The colours in two lines, for example:
FF
RR

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have to print the colours of the Front side of a 2×2×2 Rubik’s cube after some moves.
The colours are named by the first letter of each side (Front, Back, Right, Left, Up, Down).
The moves are named the same way if you turn the side clockwise.
For example F moves the Front side clockwise, F' turns it anticlockwise and F2 turns it twice. B turns it clockwise when you look at the Back side.
You won’t be given moves such as F5, B52 or U'3.
Input
The moves in one single line, for example B' possibly with dots (for human readability, you can ignore them).
Output
The colours in two lines, for example:
FF
RR
Constraints
Example
Input
R
Output
FD
FD
